intro: Cyrtandra efatensis, commonly known as the Efaté Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Efate in Vanuatu. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many species of tropical flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in montane rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
